My response to that is that in the last 10 years, we gave the country the fastest economic growth its ever had #RahulSpeaksToArnab
Congress believes in openness,that believes in RTI,that believes in Panchayati Raj,that believes in giving people power #RahulSpeaksToArnab
What used to be hidden, can no longer be hidden. That's the bottom line #RahulSpeakstoArnab
RTI right has basically changed the game in India. What it has done, is that it has basically opened up the structures.#RahulSpeakstoArnab
You didn't ask me once about what we're going to do for the women for this country #RahulSpeakstoArnab
You didn't ask me once on how we're going to get jobs for youngsters in this country #RahulSpeakstoArnab
The fundamental question this election is, are we going to open up the system? Are we going to close the system? #RahulSpeakstoArnab
We've just said that 15 constituencies in this country in the Congress party are going to be chosen by primaries.#RahulSpeakstoArnab
I'm debating these issues by building structures in the Congress party that's going to transform it. #RahulSpeakstoArnab
Are we going to head towards empowerment of women? #RahulSpeakstoArnab
Are we going to head towards deepening our democracy & towards opening up the system or are we going to head towards concentration of power?
I don't like unfairness. It just makes my blood boil. I don't like it. And in whatever I did, if I saw unfairness #RahulSpeakstoArnab

I feel with all my heart that we need to change the system here and not enough people are actually asking that question.
#RahulSpeakstoArnab
We lose some elections, we win some elections. The real thing is that it's a heart thing.  #RahulSpeakstoArnab
Getting away from the superficialities, getting away from the small issues and moving deeper into the issues #RahulSpeakstoArnab
I understand that. And frankly, attack me all you want. Beat me to death. It's not going to stop me. #RahulSpeakstoArnab
People who are attacked in this system, the people who are actually attacked, are the ones fighting the system.#RahulSpeakstoArnab
I was at Trinity in Cambridge, I spent a year there, I did my M.Phil there.#RahulSpeakstoArnab
Pretty much every single thing I have done in my political career has been to bring in youngsters #RahulSpeakstoArnab
I think the Congress party’s strength comes when we open up when we bring in new people #RahulSpeakstoArnab
I have already said that regardless of who the person is,if there is an issue of corruption, law should take its course #RahulSpeakstoArnab
The Congress party is an extremely powerful system and all the #Congress party needs to do is bring in younger fresher faces in the election
I think we have fundamental strengths in the Congress party #RahulSpeaksToArnab
I am going to do in the future is about bringing in youngsters into the party, strengthening processes #RahulSpeaksToArnab

We are fighting an election, we are going to win that election #RahulSpeaksToArnab
Our alliance in Bihar is with a political party with an idea not an individual, we are making alliance #RahulSpeaksToArnab
Unfortunately political system today is at a particular place & I can’t simply ignore the fact that the political system is at that place
We need to bring in youngsters and we need to move away from this concentration of power #RahulSpeaksToArnab
My long term view is that we need to take the Indian political system to a different place #RahulSpeaksToArnab
None of you wants to raise that issue. The fundamental issue – How do we choose the candidate #RahulSpeaksToArnab
Everybody is perfectly happy with 500 people running the entire system in India. None of you wants to raise that issue #RahulSpeaksToArnab
The real issue here is participation of people into politics. It is bringing youngsters in the political system. #RahulSpeaksToArnab
Core reason the season is corrupt is that there is too much concentration of power in system & people on the peripheries do not have power.
We have to change the way the system works. We are always talking about peripheral things. #RahulSpeaksToArnab

As far as any corruption done, there is a legal process. And that legal process should be followed and concluded #RahulSpeaksToArnab

What I will say is that there are six bills in parliament that are sitting  there bring them in. Pass them. #RahulSpeaksToArnab
What I will say is that in the Congress party anybody who does any act of corruption will be taken up and punished #RahulSpeaksToArnab

The central issue in all this is what is the power of MP,the power of MLA& the power of the Pradhan in political system? #RahulSpeaksToArnab
One has to take care that one is not creating imbalances in the system. And that's something that one has to discuss. #RahulSpeaksToArnab

I am the first person who has been saying over the last five years, talking about transparency in the party.#RahulSpeaksToArnab
I think that political parties should be under RTI if political parties feel,& it’s a law that has to be passed in Parl. #RahulSpeaksToArnab

The difference between the 84 riots and the riots in Gujarat was that in 1984,Government was trying to stop the riots #RahulSpeaksToArnab
I do not take my anger which existed on 2 individuals,who did something evil & wrong -overlay it on millions of people. #RahulSpeaksToArnab

I want to empower people and I want to make India, together with everybody.#RahulSpeaksToArnab

We will be forever grateful that such a one as he walked this earth of ours.(23/23)
Today, I join millions of Indians in mourning his loss. We feel bereft, as though we have lost a beloved father.  (22/23)
because he was a leader who belonged to all humanity, a towering beacon for all who cherish freedom, democracy and social justice. (21/23)
We awarded him the Bharat Ratna, the highest honour that India can bestow, because we loved and revered him, (20/23)
We felt deeply honoured that after his release from prison, India was one of the first countries he visited, in 1990. (19/23)
Madiba was a beloved figure in India. (18/23)
So did his moral authority, shining bright like a guiding star in a troubled world.  (17/23)
His spirit remained  indomitable and undimmed till the end. (16/23)
support and hope for oppressed and marginalized people all over the world. (15/23)
In his retirement from public life, Madiba continued to be a figure of inspiration, (14/23)
even though his country pleaded with him to stay as their President for Life. (13/23)
Like a true democrat, he voluntarily renounced political power and office after serving for five years as President of South Africa, (12/23)
His own courage was almost superhuman, yet he had the gift of inspiring others to acts of extraordinary heroism as well. (11/23)
Nelson Mandela always led from the front but, like a true leader, he had the gift of taking others along with him. (10/23)
to erase the lethal legacy of apartheid, break down the barriers of hatred and distrust (8/23)
He emerged from his long incarceration with not a trace of bitterness or vengeance in his heart, only a renewed determination (7/23)
his courage never wavered, nor did his conviction that his cause was just and true.  (6/23)
Over the 10,000 days he spent in a brutal prison, sacrificing 27 years of his life for the freedom of his people, (5/23)
Nelson Mandela redefined the meaning of courage, sacrifice, and forgiveness. (4/23)
Through the long years of his struggle for South Africa’s freedom—freedom from oppression, racial prejudice, inequality and poverty— (3/23)
With the passing away of Nelson Mandela, the world is deprived of a luminous presence and a radiant spirit. (2/23)
Congress President Smt Sonia Gandhi's condolence message on death of Nelson Mandela (1/23)
